Reviews.Title: “Paradise found....”
Reviews.Author: Hulagirlinaz
Reviews.Content: Tranquil.....I have lived in Hawaii over 10 years and have found a gem!! I love the level of intimacy here - our bungalow was right on the water so please take a peek at the pictures to see the views. Even typing to you now on the lanai, I have enclosed a photo while typing. The views are breath-taking - the Ko'olau mountain range expresses a different feeling as the clouds hover in and out. So serene.... Take a kayak out into the bay and explore or play pool or deck side....ahhhh. I love the convenience of the kitchenette in our room - I like to have my coffee before venturing out. Trust me - you do not want to see me before I have had my coffee :) I travel often and I am usually in a hurry to get somewhere....but all time stops here. I can hear the water breaking from my bed, the birds singing....it is so peacefull here!! so green... Close enough to local shopping and local hangouts to get the vibe of this side. Love it. Everyone has been so friendly and happy here - good "mana" here!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise is Right!”
Reviews.Author: Christa L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the weekend of August 17, 2012 (yes, the same weekend as Elliott referred to as the "nuisance wedding," I hope he and his wife's nuptials wasnt so harshly referred to as such - I'm sure they would feel awful for raining on someone's weekend - *eyeroll*). ANYWAY- I am not understanding what the negative reviews regarding the continental breakfast are. Continential insinuates that it will be a light breakfast will be made available - if they were offering made to order meals, I am sure they would refer to it as a breakfast kitchen and not refer to it as continental. All griping aside, I thoroughly enjoyed the crockpot oatmeal with a plethera of topping options, the variety of breakfast breads and fruits, the jam selections were fantastic and have left me obsessed with guava jam. There also gave the option of making your own eggo waffles, which was nice if you werent feeling particularly experimental with anything. The view from the breakfast balcony is second to none. Listening to the light wind rustling through the trees in the mountain while watching the thick fog slowly lift off of the bay was just a fantastic way to spend waking up in the morning. Moving along, the rooms were beautifully remodeled and very convenient with the kitchenette built in to every room with a fully stocked kitchen including all cooking and eating utensils. The beds were soft and comfortable, the A/C in our room kept inside nice and chilled away from the humid, high temperatures out. They were clean and classy; the remodel was done tastefully and appealing without being overbearing on the designer's individual taste. Another random sidenote: I only noticed one cat throughout my stay. The neighborhood the resort is in is nothing fancy, there is no hiding that. It is a working class neighborhood and you really must consider this people - they are minimalists and are not a materialistic people. They are good people, kind and friendly and will never be of any threat to any traveler. This area is far off the beaten tourist path - it is "real" Hawaii, not a tourist postcard. I could go on and on about this resort, but I will leave some fun experience to you the traveler. I will leave you saying that I did not want to leave this Paradise and I am already checking my calendar to see when I can return!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it somewhat but too many glitches”
Reviews.Author: Elliot254
Reviews.Content: Dates stayed: 8/14/2012 to 8/18/2012 Room type: One bedroom suite on Kaneohe Bay. My wife and I wanted to stay in a nice quiet place on the windward side of the island. Because of the mixed reviews we figured give it a try for 4 nights. The best way to describe this resort is an inexpensive condo/motel built right on Kaneohe Bay in a local neighborhood fishing village. Part of the local feeling means you experience everything good and bad in the neighborhood. Stray cats are numerous perhaps because the neighbors have lots of stuff lying around. A guy in uniform walked up to the coffee pot, filled his mug, and left, so part of this experience is you are integrated into the neighborhood. The setting is definitely beautiful with the mountains in the background and gentle waves. However even as the staff was very courteous and helpful, the feeling of the inexpensive condo/motel showed through. I'll explain below. We were very disappointed by the breakfast. They called this a "continental breakfast". It felt like everything they had out was purchased in bulk at Costco including the plastic silverware and plates. The pineapple was excellent and in season, but the papaya was bitter and underripe. The choices were also inconsistent; one day the oranges disappeared so I asked Napua what happened. She went into the office to ask someone and didn't come out for 10 minutes so I gave up. The oatmeal was the cheap instant oatmeal quite unlike what you'd expect from a good home cooked breakfast. All of the other items were just ordinary store bought breads and pastries. I've been at many B&Bs, and they always add a personal touch with some special cooked items but there was none of this here. Since we had the one bedroom suite, we ended up just taking a few items back to our room - the better fruit and some coffee. My wife tells me the coffee was mediocre - isn't Hawaii supposed to be famous for good coffee? I can't understand the deal with the papaya because we purchased this on our own and it was very sweet unlike the papaya they served at the breakfast here. Our one bedroom suite was recently renovated and when we were there, other rooms were also being renovated. The room was definitely clean. It was a lifesaver to have a fully equipped kitchen because of the lack of a decent breakfast - my wife and I like eating full hearty breakfast on vacation :). There are still some things lacking though. The main thing that bothered us is the fridge was old and clunky, making a popping noise every 15-20 minutes. This combined with the poor building sound insulation made for some restless sleeping. A note for guests wandering around the resort at 5:30-6:00AM in the morning that your conversations, laughing, arguing, etc. can be clearly heard. The AC is similarly loud and old but fortunately with the ocean breezes it isn't needed at night. The shower curtain rings pop off every time you close the shower curtain making even the basic showering a bit of a challenge. The dresser for putting clothing has no rails which makes it difficult to use. The microwave was placed on top of the fridge because of a lack of counter space; would have been much better to have a built-in because the kitchen is a bit small. The walkway to the villa was poorly lit and probably treacherous for someone elderly. Upon checking in we went down a really steep driveway to get to our room. The spaces were limited and often full, and it was a big challenge getting in and out of that lot. I ended up crunching my bumper trying to navigate between cars and getting up the steep driveway. The resort itself is very small. The swimming pool is barely big enough to jump in and cool off. But I did get to enjoy canoeing in the large bay. It's very peaceful and relaxing and free for resort guests. If you want to try this make sure you're in good shape before you go out because it can be a bit of a workout when you row against the current. The resort also had stand up paddle boards available for a fee which I didn't get to try, but I imagine that would be fun especially when the waves are bigger in the winter. The service there was actually very warm and inviting. They always had great suggestions for things to do in the area and loved to tell stories. I do remember Napua and Kaylee who were very helpful in welcoming us to the resort and giving us suggestions of things to do. If the breakfast were better this would have been a true B&B experience ;). Things weren't so smooth when we first got there after a 14 hour flight; Napua told us "check-in isn't until 3PM" but after I explained that Tom told us they would try to make the room available if possible, she made up for it by getting housekeeping on it and walking down to our room with us to see if we needed anything. A nice touch for sure. When we stayed there, someone rented out the resort for a wedding. Normally that wouldn't be a problem but since the resort is so small, it really detracted from the experience. The wedding took over the entire parking lot and barbecue area so we all had to fight for parking spaces on the upper level. Shame on the management for not letting guests know until we were actually staying there and had no other options. Hopefully in my review I've painted a clear picture of what it's like to stay here. I really tried to have an open mind about this and have stayed in everything from one star basic motels to 5+ star hotels and resorts worldwide. While the Paradise Bay Resort is beautiful and relaxing, and the staff is very welcoming, the subpar breakfast, resort, & room facilities, and especially the nuisance of a wedding taking over the resort made this a real mixed bag experience and definitely not worth paying the 4-5 star resort price. This really doesn't provide the great "alternative to Waikiki" that it should be providing.

Reviews.Title: “Love it like my second home!”
Reviews.Author: Jennftb
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough nice things about Paradise Bay Resort. I've stayed there 7 times now over a year and a half. I've watched the renovations that have made the spacious rooms beautiful and comfortable with all the amenities of home. The location is perfect for me as I love being off the beaten path, especially with the amazing views of the mountains. I love the private ownership and personal touches that the owners and staff do for their guests. The kayaks, paddleboards, sand bar cruise and Wed night luau with local musicians, Kimo and guests, are the biggest treats that I never tire of. I never want to leave and I look forward to my return. Thank you staff of Paradise Bay Resort!

Reviews.Title: “TRUE paradise, not some Waikiki tourist trap.”
Reviews.Author: RYANBARENG
Reviews.Content: This is as good as it gets.  Have stayed at many resorts all over the world and this is in the top %3!!! MILITARY FRIENDLY (and on TLA list).  Not to mention, the ONLY resort on this side of the Island. FRIENDLY staff and I saw the OWNERS every other day as they were doing maintenance and upgrades on the property.   WEDNESDAY dinner was fun, FRIDAY fire show was AMAZING! As far as constructive criticism. Too many cats in the area. Housekeeping is few and far between, but they did wash the dishes which surprised me. I'd Definitely stay here again next time I'm on TLA!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend a very nice and memorable vacation in a peaceful place where you can enjoy beautiful views and nature, choose this place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Christopher C
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently, first impression, where am I. Not the best of neighborhoods, run down homes surround the "hotel". Our rooms were small for a two bedroom "suite". Furniture needs major overhaul. Complimentary breakfast needs updating. Same offerings every single day we stayed. :-( For the price we paid for our tiny two bedroom "suite", it was definitely not the experience we expected for our first visit to Hawaii. The one bright spot was the Saturday boat excursion. Would we return to PBR? It would take a lot of arm twisting for us to return.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise bay was just our speed”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: The beautiful backdrop for this resort makes it a unique experience. The views from the breakfast area are fantastic. The room was large and clean with a lanai. We used the pool, hot tub and took a kayak out to the reef. The staff was very courteous and accommodating. I would recommend this resort to those looking to stay away from the busy city scene.

Reviews.Title: “Do you feel lucky?”
Reviews.Author: Traveling M
Reviews.Content: Just looking at the wide variation in evaluations should be enough warning to RUN! There must be som e decent units somewhere to prompt the favorable reviews. Ours had not a single drawer in which to put clothes, and my thermometer still read in the low 90's at 9PM on on mild Spring day. To add insult to injury they charged for an extra day becaus e we left after one night. We wonder how often that little number gets repeated. A travel agent who lives less than an hour away, and should know better, put us here. Don't even think about staying here until you have carefully examined in person, exactly what you are getting. Otherwise, this is like the lottery.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: jujuyee
Reviews.Content: My immediate & extended family and I stayed at Paradise bay to have a mini vacation after my sister's wedding in Oahu. The location of the hotel was just breathtaking. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We stayed in connecting units 15, 16, 17 if i remember correctly. The large unit (#16) was beautiful and spacious but fell short because of how it was furnished. I felt the furniture was too small for the size of the room. There was a small square raised table with 3 bar stools to dine on. One small wicker couch and one single arm chair. The family intended to use this as a hub for meals and family time. But because we were group of 10 there wasn't quite enough furniture for all of us to be comfortable. We made it work the 4 nights we were there. I did feel a bit isolated because the surrounding neighbors were all residential homes. And it wasn't exactly a nice and scenic surrounding area around the resort. I was really excited to do all the water activities, especially paddle boarding. But the condition of the water was a bit muddy for my liking. The water level in the morning was very low so I was a bit disappointed. Kayaking and snorkeling gear is free which was great! It is a ten-fifteen minute drive into town to pick up groceries or shop which was really convenient. It was a REALLY nice surprise that there was a wonderful farmers market inside the Windward mall on Wednesday evening from 2:30-7:30 we found all sorts of great exotic fresh fruit and vegetables. On top of all the tasty local food stands. http://www.windwardmall.com/event/farmers-market-every-wednesday/ Continental breakfast was a bit limited. Consisted of 1-2 types of cut fresh fruit (we had sweet pineapple and papaya the days were were there) , bagels, toast, and costco individually wrapped danish. Yoplay yogurt, juice, tea, and coffee was also offered. The Wednesday night Mai thi dinner was VERY nice. Live guitarist and after dinner fire dancing was GREAT! Although they forgot to announce before we headed down to the floating docks to watch the fire dancing show that there would be dessert. Rooms were clean and spacious. Beds were comfortable however we could have used a thin blanket on the cooler nights. There was just a flat sheet and a long decorative curtain panel at the foot of the bed. Also 2 out of the 3 bathroom toilets would constantly be running and not flush half of the time (frustrating!). I've roughed it plenty of times and I am a backpacking, camping out in the middle desert kind of gal. But for the prices per night to stay at this B&B there is DEFINITELY room for improvement!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and different”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne090
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2012 in a room overlooking the pool. This must be one of the unrenovated parts of the hotel, it was very dark but there was a nice balcony with a table and chairs. The walls were rather thin, you could hear the conversations next door and the footsteps on the floor above. Our room had a fridge and we were able to cook if we wanted.The rooms aren't serviced everyday, something that seemed strange as part of the holiday experience is not having to make beds. The hotel had some entertainment nights which were low key but quite pleasant, and the trip to the sandbar was excellent. The boys who took us were really friendly. Breakfast was simple and a good start to the day.The hotel is in a run down area and there is nothing around, you need a car to go out for dinner etc. It was ideal if you want a quiet spot away from the tourist traps, a no fuss holiday.

Reviews.Title: “The worst, I'm sorry to say.”
Reviews.Author: N0rthVanc0uverFamily
Reviews.Content: We checked in late at night in March - a tired family of 5, booked for 10 days. It truly is the junkiest place I've seen. Presumably there must be some higher-end suites somewhere on the property (the pictures on the website show somewhere nice??), but the ones I saw were like motel 6. The minute I walked in I told the young guy who was there that we needed to be moved - and there was nothing to go to as it was full. I said, we're checking out in the morning, and he said OK. Never asked "What's wrong" or "why don't you like it?" or "How can I help" - just, OK. I bet every single person who sees those rooms, immediately says I'm out of here. Everything I've read from unhappy customers I agree with - paper thin walls, old and uncomfortable furniture, a stove from 1960, untrained and uncaring staff, renovations going on everywhere at all hours, a dodgy neighborhood with nothing around it within walking distance. I'm not impressed with the false advertising of Paradise Bay Resort, and I feel sorry for anyone who wasn't happy but stayed anyway. The minute I checked in (by then 11pm), I got on my laptop and booked another place in Waikiki - for $150. per night, instead of the $175. we were being charged at this place. We hightailed it out of Paradise Bay first thing in the morning - and it ended up being SO much nicer, with lovely balconies looking over the ocean, great staff, and a clean and safe place. These crumby rooms seem like a roadside motel, where you could survive spending a night or two. And if they charged less than $100. and marketed it as a budget place, that would be fine. A resort it sure isn't, Even if you got one of the mystery nice rooms, the pool is tiny and the much advertised breakfast is instant oatmeal, one type of fruit and a bagel you can toast. You can do so much better than stay here! I hope the owners are taking note of these reviews, as they are renovating and re-branding I feel they're doing a terrible job with their reputation, misrepresentation, and many unhappy customers who are telling everyone they know not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and views.”
Reviews.Author: Susan987654
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago before the renovation. It was well worn but comfy. This time I brought friends who had never been to Hawaii. The unit was brand new, wood floors, new kitchen, baths, every room was very pretty. The Veiw from the open patio was spectacular. The best improvement was the pool area. Last time I was there it was unuseable, this time the pool and hot tub were perfect. They were still working on some of the units, so I'm sure it will be even better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Bay Resort, No Ka Oi”
Reviews.Author: teritico
Reviews.Content: This is truly the most unique hotel in Hawaii and the Pacific. No other hotel in the islands can boast over-the-water bungalows or the genuine hospitality of the owners and staff. Falling asleep while listening to the gentle waves lapping underneath the floor is like being transported to another world. When you wake up in the morning and walk out to your lanai, the Koolau Mountains are fully lit with golden light from the rising sun. It is truly heaven on earth.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising - NOT at all a Resort - Fix-er-up motel maybe”
Reviews.Author: ournanna
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with all the negtive feedback that others have given. When we first pulled up, I was so embarrased thay the other 5 guests in our party counted on me to plan their first trip to Hawaii and see this. We tried to cancell or ask for different rooms and we were told it was booked for the weekend. This shocked me. Yes, cats were everywhere, the smell of cat urin was so strong outside of the room that they gave us and because of my allergies, I insisted that they move us. One of our rooms were moved to a different building that the others and what a shame. 1st the maintenance personnel DO NOT work on the weekends, and all the lights going down the stairs to our room were out, and my husband and I almost fell down the steps. when I mentioned this to the desk clerk he said here's a flash light and I promise it will be fixed in the morning. But guess what it never was when I asked again the next evening why it was not fixed. We were told that they do not work on weekends. They DO NOT CLEAN ROOMS, change sheets or sweep the floors on the weekend. So we were given a broom to sweep it our selves. This was never advertised on the website as we only rented this place for the weekend. I have pictures of my husband almost falling and all the lights out and the stepts, alley way and walkway being totally dark all three nights we were there. Yes, the breakfast was nice plain and basic but ok. As far as the Mi tai night, we were told as soon as we walked up to the lobby that we could only have 2 each, and we would have to wait awhile because they ran out and had to make more. The scenery is pretty, the loby are is nice, but the hotel rooms have alot to be desired. The outside is very rundown. It looked like maybe they were just starting to landscape everything was dug up, and honestly, it looked terrible. I also took pictures of that. Out of a 10, I would give it a 2. BUT the rooms were clean that is all I can say about the place. OLD but clean. There was one girl there on Friday night (when we checked in) that was nice and helpful. Other than that forget it. We felt like we were bothering them. We did not go out on the boat ride Honestly because we could not wait to get away from the place. We only slept there at night. It is away from the husstel and bussel of Waikii, but we definately would never stay there again or recommend it. We were given a hotel comment card when we left and was told that a manager would call us about the problems we had, and I left our cell phone number, but no one ever called us back. I lost the comment card as traveled to two other island after that trip so that is why I am writing this. They knew of all the problems we had and never once did they say we are sorry, how can we make it up to you, offer to upgrade us or give us a credit. If you can find another place on the windward side, do, we rented homes on every other island and it was perfect. Unfortunately this was the only hotel we could find on the windward side. Big Mistake!!

Reviews.Title: “False Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: 65Margarita65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there one week, celebrating our Wedding Anniversary... Not what we were expecting...We will never go back or even recommend this MOTEL!! STRAY CATS are living under the buildings. Seems like the lady owner loves them.. Not a good place to relax.. The room was more like a MOTEL!! by far the best was the boat ride.. Not to go back to FALSE PARADISE!!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this place”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth T
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say my husband and I are not "resort" or "cruise" people. We would rather stay in a house or apartment then a 5 star resort. With that said, we loved this place. The setting is tranquil and gorgeous, the grounds are very nice with old growth trees and shrubs, lava tiled walkways, lanais off of most rooms. The pool area is very stylish, the self serve barbecues are next to the floating docks with a nice view of the lagoon, the public lanai is a great place to hang out and have breakfast. Our room had a beautiful lanai with a bay view, and the egyptian cotton bedding was soft and comfy. The kitchenettes are great for light meals & snacks. The neighborhood is colorful and local Hawaii, I don't think the other reviewers who complain about the surrounding houses being dumpy realize that those "dumps" are million dollar pieces of property. Getting to north shore and into Kaneohe for shopping was a breeze. We will be back, my husband has monthly business in Kaneohe and I can't wait to return with him.

Reviews.Title: “Need to work on their customer service”
Reviews.Author: Penny R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there 10 days in March. Our first impression was of the junky houses and clutter in the neighborhood. The man at the desk that "greeted" us was not friendly, didn't even smile and acted like he could have cared less if we were there or not. Not a very good first impression! Luckily we were gone every day and only slept there. The food for the Wed nite buffet was average, but they need to make sure there's enough! The bread/rolls were not even enough for the people in line...and they didn't refill till everyone had already finished. And they seriously need to hire some better housekeeping staff. We never knew who was in charge, no employee introduced themselves to us....never knew who worked there and who didn't. They need to have a list of local restaurants, etc. to hand to people when they check in. We had to ask about everything! We weren't told about the laundry room...we "heard" another guest talking about it. Definately wouldn't stay there again. Their website is totally misleading. The ONLY positive thing is it's away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Choose with caution”
Reviews.Author: EBstarRN
Reviews.Content: Although I loved the area we stayed in ( Kaneohe ), I wasn't too fond of the "hotel". I called multiple times before we arrived to make sure we were going to get a decent room so I was confident staying there even with some of the bad reviews. To my disappointment, when we arrived our room looked like a poor 2 bedroom apartment. No decorations, and absolutely no view ( unless you consider the clutter filled houses across the street a view ). As if we weren't paying enough already , we ended up having to pay a lot more to upgrade our room to one that was better with actual breathing room for a family of four. Thinking back on it now I much rather have paid the money to stay at the Marriott condos in Koolina. It was definitely too much money for what we got. Pros: breakfast every morning. Not much to choose from. Dinner on Wednesday, Mai tais were ok, you can only have two. The food was not good at all but I ate it because I was starving. The best thing about the whole stay was the Saturday sand bar tour and being able to use the kayaks. Also the area had breathtaking views. Staff was nice and helpful. The area was quiet. More cons: Rooms are old, furniture is bad, beds are bad, faucets leak, ants in the kitchen, neiborhood is bad ( not your typical resort setting), FALSE advertisement, and way too expensive for what you get. I would not reccomended this place to any of MY family or friends but everyone has different expectations and standards so just choose wisely before you pick this place. If you have high standards go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say after flying 4,000 miles that we drove to this location and was GREATLY disappointed that we were going to be spending 9 nights in this "Resort". We have stayed at many resorts and/or B&B's and this was definitely not either. It is in a neighborhood surrounded by cars on blocks and roosters crowing across the street. Not to mention the MANY stray cats that roam the property. It was UNBELIEVABLE. We looked at a room and decided that this wasn't the "GETAWAY" we were looking for. Very disappointing that they also kept our first night of about $250. The pictures on their website is NOTHING like the location. We were truly upset and sorry that this place did not meet the expectations that the website promised.

Reviews.Title: “WORST PLACE TO STAY--FLEAS!!!”
Reviews.Author: jcrader
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this crap resort. and it was the WORST trip of my life, and I've never staed in a resort before. I had a horrible experience with everything. The room, the staff, the property, everything. There are cats living on the property under the buildings, complete with FLEAS. My son got eaten up, the staff told me it was from mosquitos, and was to be expected in that area. I told them I thought it was fleas but I was reassured it was mosquitos, nothing to worry about. everytime I told them they let me know they had already fumigated the place. But the fleas are there as a result of their cats, as I said before. I got home with my Doctor and my son had a fever of 105, the doctor told me that the bites were in fact from fleas, that were spreading viruses. which is why my son got so sick. He told me I should report them for the infestation. But living so far away I really don't want to go to the trouble, they should really be thankfull. but I will be calling the city to make them aware of whats going on there. I just want other people going with small children to be aware of what would be in store for them. This place is DIRTY, they do NOT take care of ANYTHING, there are cockroaches and ants running through the kitchens. This place is NOT worthy of the title RESORT, its barely a livable motel. I heard some ladies talking about the owners telling their friends to put up good reviews so that people would think it was a good place to stay. I was reading the reviews of the other people, I dont want to hear "sorry and that things will get better" that is BS, i am CERTAIN other people have made you aware of your flea INFESTATION, and CLEARLY you havent done a damn thing about the cats on the property.

Reviews.Title: “I'll take Paradise Bay Resort over Waikiki Beach any day”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 3 days at Paradise Bay Resort. After a few days at a Waikiki Beach hotel for a convention, this quiet spot off the beaten track was just what we wanted. We took kayaks out each morning without the hassle of renting and we loved that. We also used the snorkel gear (although the water in front of the resort was not so clear when we were there, and I wish we had booked a guided tour out to Sand Island -- need to plan ahead for that.) We stayed in a mountain-view room and it was beautifully decorated, with a private lanai. My only complaint is that sound-proofing between rooms could be improved. But with lots of nice bonuses -- towels, gear, good (free!) food and music on Wednesday night, very friendly and helpful staff, and a cute dog, too -- well, I'll take Paradise Bay resort over Waikiki any day!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie G
Reviews.Content: Paradise Bay in Kaneohe Bay is a hidden treasure. It was quiet, relaxing and tranquil. Our room was like a studio version of "home" with modern decor, flat screen tv and wardrobes to be envied. The kitchenette would allow anyone a comfortable stay for days. (It had it all: blender, pans, dishes...)The boat crew and resort staff were so friendly & helpful. The trip to the sandbar and the reef snorkeling were a dream come true; I could have spent all day out there. The bay is perfect for kayaking or stand up paddling and both are available just for the asking. No matter what water activity you choose, all you need is your swimsuit and they provide the rest! Outdoor breakfast before paddling was a treat as we found an assortment of fruit, baked goods, warm beverages, their signature Passion Juice & more. My boyfriend and I had an amazing stay---it was just too short. No doubt, we'd come again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, "interesting" location. B&B not a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JulianHall
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop during our honeymoon trip to Hawaii. We had considered Honolulu side, but decided that we would prefer a bit of peace and quiet in paradise for the start of our trip. We arrived via transfer, having neglected to book a rental car (much to our loss); as it is a way from the airport expect a shuttle to set you back about $50 or more for a taxi. This lack of planning was of course our fault, but a costly one! The hotel staff however were extremely helpful in arranging the nearest Rental company to come and collect us to sort out a rental as well as booking a taxi for our return. Advice - rent a car from the airport to save on transfers! Upon arrival, we were shown to our room (after the suggested check in time) to find it had not been properly cleaned. We informed the receptionist, and a very apologetic cleaning lady arrived minutes later to tidy it all and even gave us a box of chocolates by way of apology for the inconvenience, which I thought was a nice touch. We were a little let down by this first impression however and slightly bemused by the surrounding area. The resort is set down a slightly shabby residential street - no other facilities are within comfortable walking distance, no food/restaurant options - nothing. With a car this is less of an issue (see notes above), but it does mean you need to bring in all your supplies with you. Aside from a continental (bagels, yoghurt and fruit) breakfast, Paradise Bay provides no food (unless you count microwaveable cheeseburgers), which I think is a major failing in the type of Resort it is aspiring to be. I heard from several different people however that it has undergone extensive renovation over the last couple of years, so maybe this is something which it will develop in time - it would benefit the guests and the feel of the resort considerably. It is also slightly misleading with the Mai Tai evening notes - although it looks like a bar/restaurant, it does not serve drinks normally, so off to the shops again you go.... Kaneohe is not far by car (10 mins drive) and is pretty well served for shopping choices along with several dining options (think more local and lower end chain restaurants rather than fancy sit down affairs), so this served as our base for food and drink to bring back to the Resort. We would have had no problem with this if we had been aware beforehand that neither food nor drink are readily available on site, with no immediate alternative facility in place. Finding the resort on a "Hotels" website did unfortunately give us a slightly misinformed view of the site. This is a Bed & Breakfast not a hotel, and I do not think this is overly clear in the online information. The resort, being set in a very local area, seems also to be used regularly by the local community. Virtually every night, locals came over from the road and were playing around in the pool (noisily) for some time. Several locals also came over to enjoy breakfast on a regular basis. Perhaps this is joint owned by the community, in which case of course they would wish to avail of the facilities, or perhaps it is open to locals in order to prevent any feeling of segregation or ill feeling in the neighbourhood. Regardless, it is a little galling to those of us who have travelled a LONG way to relax and paid for the privilege too to share the area with those who can enjoy it for free. Perhaps I am missing the point, and should be more community minded, but the impression and the price tag of the "resort" suggest something more than they actually provide. My review is probably coming over as rather negative, however my wife and I really did enjoy our time here. The view from our room was fantastic looking our on to the river and the hills in the distance (however it was only partial bay view - more sea view commanded a considerable premium on our already non budget price). Not all the rooms benefit from such a pleasing wakeup vista - several of the rooms look out on to the residential street out the front, and I would really not have been very pleased if we had one of these! Three or four lodgings actually front out onto the bay, with many of the others like ours facing the mountains (still delightful). So in short: The pros: - View (if you have partial/full bay view) - Nice pool & hot tub - Lovely views of bay & mountains - Jungle noise in the mornings - amazing! - Fantastic views from breakfast bar - Helpful staff - Free kayaking into the bay - great fun! - Good location for Valley of the Temples and exploring the North Shore - Much quieter than the Southern side of the island The cons: - View (if you got a street facing room, which we didn't!) - Too pricey for the limited facilities available - No food/drink options available beside breakfast - Location is "weird" in terms of the surrounding messy residential area - Rooms not as private as could be (thin walls, wicker/bamboo screens) - Noisy locals detract from the solace Would I stay here again? If I could get a good deal on the price then yes. If they start serving proper food and drink then definitely. If you want local amenities, then look elsewhere, but for a quiet retreat it fits the bill nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bambi C
Reviews.Content: Don't believe what you see on their website I wouldn't even call this a hotel. It's more like a motel and a bad one at that!! Although the view is nice the rooms are terrible!! The room we stayed in lacked any real character and instead felt very cold and uninviting. Large space for nothing with hardly any furniture no curtain on the kitchen window and extremely thin and see through curtains on the other windows making it not private and other units around us could see right into our room!! There were adjoining doors with about an inch of space underneath so that EVERYTHING said from the other room could be heard as if they were right in our room!! It was also very annoying that every sound from the room above was heard all the noise is due to the fact that there are bare floors in every room It was so noisy that I couldnt even sleep!!! Poor lighting at night with steep steps to our room made matters worse and with the rain I almost fell very dangerous I would never go back!!! It's not with it. There are a lot of better cheaper and safer places to go than here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: Liz D
Reviews.Content: Our stay was unbelievable! The staff is so helpful, knowledgable and friendly. Our room was beautiful and perfect for a family - two bedrooms and a huge bathroom. On top of that our view was incredible! The lanei was a perfect place to relax with coffee in the morning and a glass of wine at night. Plus all of the activities really allow you to experience the best of Hawaii without the chaos of Waikiki. If you are spending time in Hawaii you should definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “BIG DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: Marcia A
Reviews.Content: the employees were friendly and helpful...the food was terrible for the Wednesday Hawaiian night....Not fit for a cafeteria menu...The rooms were very clean, the view was gorgeous... Our room was overlooking the pool...Asked for an upgrade but told that they were booked up that week... After talking to a guest, they said that the room next to them was vacant all week......Big mistake...too much noise and it was also directly below the serving area for breakfast which started lots of overhead noise starting at 530 am every morning.,,,, which was lacked a lot of imagination......Eggos, bagels, papaya, pineapple, coffee, yogurt...7 days in a row....I traveled thousands of miles for this? Instant hot chocolate and instant oatmeal...Are you kidding???? The last night of our romantic 35 anniversary vacation, the next door guests were drunk and had an all out fight....slamming doors, cussing, sobbing and lots of yelling at midnight. Someone called the police and they talked to them for a few minutes and then left...The yelling, sobbing and slamming of doors continued until well after 1 am...none of the night staff did anything to shut them up.......Very disappointed...I feel like we we really screwed over....the Saturday boat ride was the highlight.....

Reviews.Title: “Very peaceful and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: NoRoBo
Reviews.Content: We took our 10 year son on his first Hawaiian vacation during his Spring break and he loved it. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The resort is still going through some renovations so hopefully they will be done by the time we return. We had a two bedroom unit which I found somewhat small and it did not have any dressers. Our unit was also very plain with no art or decorations. However, the peaceful environment and helpful staff made it worth while. My son enjoyed the pool and our family loved the boat ride to the sand bar. We also enjoyed all the birds, cats, and chickens roaming through the neighborhood. Our family enjoyed the dinner and live music on Wednesday night. We would definitely recommend this resort. It beats staying in crowded Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: trisha2marie3
Reviews.Content: What a perfect name for a perfect place! Absolute Paradise! My fiancé and I just got back from the most amazing weekend. We just needed to get away, and wanted a nice place to relax, be near the water, and most importantly some place quite! We got it all. After getting to the resort fairly late on Friday night, around 8:30pm, we were greeted by name and checked in by Tiana. She was so kind, gave us all of our information, and even a welcome MaiTai left over from their Friday night happy hour. She escorted us to our water front suite, and when I say water front I mean the gentle waves came right up to our lanai. It was a low tide and full moon and so beautiful. The room was clean, modern, and had everything we could have asked for. We had planned to grill up some steaks that evening, and even though the grill closed at 9:00pm we promised to be very quiet and were allowed to use the grills. The kitchenette had everything we needed, and we cooked up our veggies in the suite. We brought our dinner back to the room, and enjoyed eating in the kitchenette area, with all the doors up (and screens closed) to the sound of our iPod in the provided speaker dock, and the sounds of nature. Wind, waves, birds, bugs and even a little cat fight was music to our ears. So much better than city streets, garbage trucks and fighter jets outside our apartment window in downtown Honolulu. We woke up the next morning to the birds in the trees and had a relaxing morning of drinking tea on the lanai. We got ready, and I would like to note that the water pressure in the shower was very powerful. We then went to the breakfast in the lobby, and a toasted bagel and yogurt got us set up for our snorkel cruise. Since the tide was so low, the boat crew had their work cut out for them to get the boat going, but go it did. The crew was so kind, and even with the clouds, the scenery is always breathtaking. We saw turtles galore, and the snorkeling is unreal. K-Bay is by far the healthiest reef on the island, and the fish just swarm you. The boat provided equipment, but we brought our own. Then we headed out to the sand bar, where we got to play volley ball provided from one of the other tours. Then the hot tub was just right for the cloudy day. After lunch and a Saturday afternoon nap, we got ready for dinner. It was just a short taxi ride to Haleiwa Joe's for dinner and drinks. Then about a $30 cab ride to Kailua for Fromaggio's Wine bar. We are fine with paying for taxi's (we are city people), and understood from the start that there weren't going to be too many happening places for Saturday night, so we were good. That afternoon and night at the resort, there was a wedding party right next to our room, which did get a bit noisy, but they were having a good time so it was fine with us. Another relaxing morning on Sunday was the perfect way to wrap our stay. The check out the next morning was smooth as could be. A perfect piece of Paradise is Paradise Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Steph217
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid (even with the local discount), I am extremely disappointed at the stay we had over the weekend. I believe that first impressions are crucial in building a positive relationship between businesses and clients. I do not believe in badmouthing workers but our negative experience at the resort was mainly due to the first 30 mins of our stay. I called two hours earlier to see if our hotel would be available before check-in time. We had a wedding to go to around the corner that evening (the reason why we decided to book the room so we could have a mini vacation) and an early check-in would make time be less of an issue. The receptionist informed us that the room wouldn't be ready until check-in time. We were fine with that and decided to explore Kaneohe instead. We arrived a little after 3pm. When we arrived, the front desk representative was assisting another guest and told us she should we back after she escorts the guests to their rooms. 2 mins later she comes back proclaiming that she forgot the room key. ::insert uncomfortable laugh:: We start to get checked-in and after 10 mins of paperwork and lack or urgency, she proceeds to "show" us our room. "showing" it to us meant that she got us lost. NO JOKE. She took us to two different rooms before proclaiming that she doesn't know where it is and that feels really bad. She was on the verge of tears. My boyfriend asks for the second time if he can see the map. She finally gives it to him the second time around and my BOYFRIEND finds the room for us. THEN, our room is not even ready! By now, it's 3:45 (45 mins past estimated check-in time). The housekeeper proclaims that the room wouldn't be ready for another 20-30 mins. Girl looks like she's about to cry again because she is smart to know how furious I am. I ask to speak to a manager. She said it's just her. I ask for another room or an upgrade. She says no. Everything's booked and there's nothing we can do. She says we can get ready in the "spa" room. By the time she GETS us to the spa room (after she has to FIND the KEY), time is up and our room is ready. She says she'll inform the manager about what happened. I just checked out today and didn't hear a thing from the manager. Utterly ridiculous. Btw, we paid for an upgrade for a View suite that was renovated. The view was not as advertised and the room didn't feel renovated. The couch on the patio was dirty and I didn't even want to sit on it. Not worth it for the 200 something we paid PER night AFTER the discount. Fix your customer service

Reviews.Title: “If you want some peace and sleep...”
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: Can't add much to the other five star reviews. We have been to Oahu at least ten times and we have always been in the Waikaki area. I now can't stand to be anywhere near there. We went one day for two hours and could not wait to get out of there. The traffic is horrible, more cars less parking. Rent a car if you go to Oahu, there is so much to see, we put 600 miles on in eleven days and our average speed was 21 MPH, be patient and go see the stuff that hasn't been over run. The resort is in a very safe neighborhood, I walked every morning at 5:00 am to the local park to watch the sunrise. Don't judge a book by its cover, it's amazing that some reviews say it's in a bad neighborhood but feel comfortable with the meth heads and hookers in Waikakii. Everyone at the resort was great. Thanks to Jason and Amber for helping us find true Hawaii. Don't overlook the sunrise at the park one block south of the resort, Mikes yellow Huli Huli chicken and shrimp truck just north of the resort. I hope no one likes this resort so there will be room when we come back, but it is full now and worth every dollar if you like to figure out Hawaii on you own, if you want some sleep and rest I recommend PBR. Thank you for the great trip !

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Pleasure Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Alohalani001
Reviews.Content: I had a great time and so did my hubby & Ohana (Family). We had great personnel from the start. There was Ms. Sarah the Manager on Duty that did great in selecting the room of her special picking just for me, as it was one of her favorites. The hugest and inviting balcony lanai I ever stayed in at a resort A great big hug to you Ms. Sarah!! Ms.Tiana was there at the Front Desk with her smiling face and "Aloha" spirit as she walked me into my gorgeous 1 bedroom suite and gave me the keys. BIG hugs there too! And then Kayleigh! Breakfast hostess with the absolute mostess! She was there every morning welcoming and preping the continental breakfast display, and what a fulfilling continental breakie I ever! The fresh papaya every morning Won us over. Super HUGS to Ms. Kayleigh. I was surprised at this get away secret, and part of me wants to keep it that way, but yet you all must go there!! Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: miranda v
Reviews.Content: Our family recently moved to O'ahu and chose to stay at Paradise Bay Resort upon arrival. Best decision we ever made! We awoke to the quiet Kaneohe Bay with the gentle waves lapping up on shore. Rainbows greeted us while white egrets flew past the gorgeous Ko'oalu range. Our two young children played freely in the small private beach and we spent many nights in the newly renovated pool and jacuzzi area. Wednesday evenings found us upstairs in the lobby where the resort hosts a weekly luau which includes delicious food, mai tai's and great Hawaiian music. On Saturday's the resort offers a boat cruise around the bay and takes guests to swim at one of the best reefs in O'ahu! The staff is very friendly and made us feel at home. For pet lovers, please note that the resort is pet friendly, which is very uncommon on island. The beds are very comfortable, and you can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “The experience of a lifetime!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jillkt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two girls moved to Hawaii from Florida with The Military in November 2011, we arrived with rooms booked on base and we are sooooooo THANKFUL that we found Paradise Bay Resort!! What a Wonderful experience we had staying there, not only my husband and myself, but for our girls as well, when it was time to leave they didnt want to!!! The staff were simply Amazing full of helpful information of what to see in Kaneohe as well as the rest of the island and they were kind and professional and quite fun, as we got to know them all for our stay with Paradise Bay was for 2months! Weekend boat ride to snorkel and the reef FREE and Wednesday night complimentary DELICIOUS dinner and cocktails with Live local performers and Friday night Mojito night, it was just sooooo much fun!!! The pool and hot tub and decks and views-"oh the views!!!"especially from most of the rooms And the out door lobby- forgot to mention breakfast outside every BEAUTIFUL morning!!!!! With fresh fruit and Great Kona coffe- yum!!!!! The new owners are delightful and very Brilliant with all their ideas that they have worked to put into making this a fantastic resort-that you might blink and miss- I love the location on route to North Shore and near Kaneohe marine Corp base and Kialua and just a quick drive through a MAGNiFICENT mountain to Honolulu and Waikiki. The rooms have been updated and have great character and decor, some have better views than others but all rooms let you take in the Hawaiian experience you may not get at some chain hotel or even other resorts!! What can I say?!?! We LOVED IT!! The Resort, The People, The Food, The Boat Rides- oh and you get access anytime for FREE to paddle boards and kayaks- I almost forgot! We made Wonderful memories at Paradise Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing place on windward side of island.”
Reviews.Author: JPM2585
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 3 night stay at Paradise Bay Resort. It was a perfect place to stay on the quiet windward side of the island. The new owners have done a great job of transforming it into a delightful relaxing environment. The extras are a nice touch including the paddle boards and kayaks that are included in the daily rates as well as the breakfasts, Wednesday dinner and Friday cocktails. We loved the opportunities to meet other guests at the breakfasts and evening events. Our studio suite was huge and had a large lanai with a great view of the bay, palm tree lined canal and the lush mountains which were full of waterfalls as it rained daily. Our building had several units in it and unfortunately the sound travelled easily through the walls. This did not really interfer with our stay but did get us up earlier than we may have liked. Staff was fantastic and I would recommend it highly except to some families since there is no beach access.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointing.... Very Misleading....”
Reviews.Author: Christine W
Reviews.Content: We had been traveling for a month and wanted somewhere quiter for a few days before we headed into the heart of Waikki.Where Paradise Bay is located seems to be a very dodgy neighbourhood and you need to have a car. We booked this resort online and it looked wonderful. The 2 bedroom apartment we were given was on the street and was so tiny, unrenovated and very very noisy, nothing like the photos on the web site. They do have some beautiful apartments on the bay but of course they were all booked out so we could not even upgrade. They really need to be more honest with their online booking system and show the rooms you actually have booked because we sure did not get the apartment shown on the booking site!!! We really didnt stay at the resort much as it was too depressing and we had a car and was off discovering the island which was beautiful and hundreds of places to choose accomadation other than Paradise Bay. After leaving We then went to Sheradin Waikkii and loved it..... Its a no brainer stay there or anywhere else instead anytime...

Reviews.Title: “A Windward Oahu Haven”
Reviews.Author: chajushu
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay at the Paradise Bay Resort in windward Oahu. I stayed here a year ago and enjoyed it, so I decided to stay here again for my yearly business trip. The resort has been completely renovated under the new owners, and provides a wonderful getaway. It's situated in a lush tropical setting with wonderful views of Kaneohe Bay and the Koolau Mountains. I grew up in Kaneohe, and this is where I want to be whenever I return to Hawaii. The staff are very friendly, expressing much Aloha. They often wear many hats and help out in different ways. A delicious buffet dinner is served on Wednesday nights for room guests. A big mahalo to Doreen, the fine lady who does the cooking. She also does other jobs at the resort. Hawaiian entertainment is provided at dinner. Another mahalo to Kimo (Wayne Kimokeo). I knew him from high school. Every morning, a nice continental breakfast is served with fresh papaya, pineapple, yogurt, and fresh pineapple juice. The rooms are nice and comfortable, and quiet. Sometimes you hear people walking upstairs. The rooms I stayed in both times had ceiling fans and AC. A newly renovated swimming pool and jacuzzi are on property, with beautiful blue tile. A coin operated laundry is on one end of the property. The resort is situated on a slope, and up and down access is by a steep driveway and stairways. There are no elevators. Parking is free but somewhat limited. There are no phones in the rooms. Housekeeping is provided every other day. The resort is situated in a working class, residential community. It does provide visitors a feel for actually being in the real Hawaii. This is a wonderful place for independent travelers like me. Many families with children were here during my stay. It's certainly the place I plan to return to each year.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL - Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Jeff M
Reviews.Content: We booked this 'Resort' online and relied of course on the pictures from their web site and Facebook site. Everything about the place looked great online and honestly their customer service was very good. However, what they show online is NOT what you get when you arrive. We stayed in room 42 which had not yet been upgraded. Overall I could have lived with the non-upgraded room had it not been for the disgusting bed. I asked for another room and come to find out even the up-graded rooms did not necessarily have new beds either. My GF saw 3 roaches in the 1-night we stayed there ... I am from Hawaii so I know about the roaches on the Windward side but if your looking for a clean and well kept place to stay on the Windward side this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Dana5333
Reviews.Content: This place is nicely tucked away in a little neighborhood, away from all the hustle and bustle. It really gives you a sense of what it's like to really live in Hawaii. Lots of roosters in this neighborhood, so no need to bring an alarm clock! The beds were sooo comfortable, and the shower was awesome...... and the views..... oooh the views are AAAH-MAY-ZING! The entire staff was so nice and very helpful durring our whole stay! Especially our bar tender Amber! Thanks for everything Paradise Bay! We can't wait to see you all again! Already thinking of planning our trip for next year. We're glad we found you!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Sandieweis10999
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Hawaii. We chose Paradise Bay for its location on the island and I am so happy we did! Our stay could not have been better. Our room was upgraded to a waterfront suite because they found out it was my birthday and first trip to Hawaii. Tiana Meyers, the assistant GM was an absolute gem. She and the entire staff were great. The room was fantastic, clean and spacious. They were renovating the pool so we were offered the paddle boat excursion to the sandbar and snorkeling as a comp. It was a great time. I could go on and on about what a wonderful place this is. I would HIGHLY recommend you book a stay with these folks as soon as possible. Thank you Paradise Bayand Tiana for making our trip one I will never forget. Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, amenities, and people.”
Reviews.Author: RpCc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week in January and it was better than expected. The location is perfect, set back in Kaneohe bay just minutes from anything you may need. The resort offers free paddle boards, kayaks which you conveniently launch out of a small cove on its property. They also offer a boat ride on Saturday mornings out to the reef for snorkeling, and to the famous Kaneohe sandbar. The staff is unmatched and everyone has been the friendliest staff at a resort my wife and I have ever encountered. We wished we had not even stayed more than a few nights in Waikiki. This side of the island is so much more beautiful, peaceful, and fun. None of the crowds out here. We will definately stay here again if we make it back out here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: anglophile58
Reviews.Content: Was not sure about Paradise Bay Resort after reading reviews but decided to go for it as several of the reviews were very positive. It was also not far from our son's apartment. Our stay there turned out to be very nice. First of all, the staff is very friendly and helpful. When Booking.com did not get our reservation in efficiently and there were no more rooms like we had reserved available, they upgraded us for the same price. The room was nice, newly renovated and clean. It had a wonderful lanai with great views out over the bay. It is not in an affluent neighborhood if that is what you want but we did not feel that the street it is on was unsafe. It is a working-class neighborhood. Another nice thing, is that there are a variety of people staying there. Met folks from different places in US but also an Aussie, folks from Scandinavia, Eastern Europe, etc. Was quite interesting. Almost every morning at breakfast we saw a rainbow over the bay. Breakfast could be a little more interesting but was quite adequate. My only complaint about breakfast was that it was not managed closely enough by staff, and we had to ask for things to be replenished. When we did, they kept an eye on it, however. Not much of a complaint. There are many other things to do, but we spent most of our time with our son. Next time we'll do more of things offered.

Reviews.Title: “Total Paradise”
Reviews.Author: C2sno
Reviews.Content: Avoid Waikiki. Get a place on the Bay. Great family, business, & romantic setting! Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what it is , but nice and relax”
Reviews.Author: Chinesechou
Reviews.Content: The positive: - Very quiet, room on the water , beautifull setting on a bay - Kayaks are a bliss - Staff is SUPER helpful, congrats to Kyle in particular -Very accomadating with needs of guests The negative: - Cannot swim in the bay as the water is very murky - Tired room (obviously not all room have been renovated) - Breakfast out of paper cup and plates looks so cheap, even if nice view! - Kitchen is too simple to cook anything

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: lisa b
Reviews.Content: My family decided to take a little get away without the busy city life so we thought of this place. The friendly staff and warm welcome and not to say all the extra ammenties my family enjoys staying here. Are stay here is well enjoyable and would recommened it to all of you the newly renovated rooms are well designed. If your looking for peace and not the busy life then this is the place you should be at.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS A JOKE!”
Reviews.Author: travel c
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paradise Bay when it was called Schraders Inn and we had a horrible experience with an old woman working at the desk when we tried to check out. We questioned the 7% surcharges that were added to our room on top of all the other taxes and the woman was extremely rude and told us that we had signed a form at check in which stated we understood our bill would incur these charges. When i asked her to explain further, as far as what these taxes are for she raised her voice to both me and my husband and said we would have to take them to court if we wanted to fuss about it and it wouldnt matter anyway because to business was up for sale anyway. Unbelievably unprofessional! When i learned that the hotel was under new managment i just had to see for myself how it had changed so i reluctantly booked for our next island visit. We arrived at night and im surprised people who havent been here before can actually find the place because the buildings are so dark and gloomy it kind of gives you a haunted house feel. Mind you we paid about $150 after all the taxes for a waterfornt bungalo 2 yrs ago and and our room rate now was about $300 so i was expecting huge upgrades. The room itself did look better, the bathroom was done over and so was the kitchen but i could still here everything that went on in the adjoined room. So if you are ok with hearing your neighbor sneeze, cough and even pass gas then this is the place for you. The breakfast even got smaller. They claim to serve fresh hawaiian fruit but all i saw was canned fruit. I was suppose to stay 4 nights but happily checked out the following morning. The absolute highlight of my stay was discovering that the rude woman who once worked at the front desk was now working as a housekeeper. I guess the new management has the smarts to know that this woman did not belong dealing with customers. All in all im going to be honest...Yes the place has been upgraded but so have the prices ( Nearly double) You can get alot more for the price you pay going else where.

Reviews.Title: “Chilling Outside of Waikiki”
Reviews.Author: JunkyBurrittos
Reviews.Content: We took a mild chance on this accommodation, as there was little information about Paradise Bay, formerly Schraeder’s Inn, on the web. While there were some favorable reviews, some in the TA community raised the concern that many of these reviewers were “one-hit-wonders” with little-to-no review history. Let me say, we really loved this place. The current owners have had this for about 9 months and have really fixed it up very nicely – touches of bamboo and art and hardwood floors and tropical plants and flowers everywhere. We were looking to escape the Waikiki city scene for our last 2 nights on Oahu and in some ways I don’t feel like we really relaxed until we got here. We took the cheapest room, a one-bedroom kitchenette suite with technically no view and a lanai for $145 a night. I say ”technically no view” because while we in reality had a “parking lot view”, it was frankly the nicest parking lot view I’ve ever had, because all you see are mountains and vegetation, and you are surrounded by colorful plants and beautiful bamboo privacy fences. Our room was on the back side of the oceanfront units, so we were within stumbling distance of the waterfront Adirondack chairs. One thing that some could find annoying but we found to be really cool were the deafening chorus of (mynah?) birds in the adjacent mangroves and the roosters from all over the neighborhood. Expect a ruckus as the sun sets and as it rises again. You may be visited by resident chickens and little dogs that chase each other around your legs, into the water, and off to another adventure. In short, this is not some sterile resort environment, but instead you are immersed in the natural environment of windward Oahu. Neighbors seem nice and as respectful to you as you are to them. Got a nice nod from a man motoring his boat up the canal early morning, and got a shaka shaka from a lady at the gas station down the street. There’s a lot of great little extras that Paradise Bay offers. Our first night there was “Mai Tai” night, a complementary night where they treat guests to a buffet dinner, free-flowing mai tai’s (which they continued to replenish long before you were ready to start looking for another), and a nice three-person Hawaiian band. While we were enjoying our relaxing evening, a steady downpour surrounded us for a brief period, but we were snug-a-bug with our mai tai’s, our full plates, new friends (certainly a chummy place), and the great music. On Friday nights they have mojito night (I love mojito’s!) and Saturday they take everyone out on their boat to the sandbar for a snorkeling excursion. I understand that’s a popular weekend excursion for residents too, so this is probably a really good time hanging out around real people from the area. Sadly, we had to check out on Friday, so we missed these other events. Kayaks and paddle boards are available for free use during your stay. We kayaked briefly when we first got there (way before check-in time, too – thanks, Darcy!) and it was very peaceful. The only potential downside here really has nothing to do with the resort. It’s only fair to mention, however, that the water in the Kaneohe area is not quite as crystalline blue as most other areas of Oahu. Still it was very peaceful and a nice place to relax waterfront or to go out kayaking or paddleboarding. Just might not be the place if you are looking for on-site beach and swimming. I also wanted to note that I think that through the use of the word “Resort” in their name, Paradise Bay may unwittingly get themselves in trouble in terms of expectations of guests who haven’t done their research. As much as I love this place, I wouldn’t naturally think of it as a resort. Oasis? Absolutely. Retreat? Sure. Resort? I don’t know – that word means different things to different people. They’ve appointed the rooms quite nicely and have a lot of extras, but for the person looking for lavish pools and spas and boutique shops, etc etc, wow, will they be surprised. Not really what this is all about. And just a quick note on service. We had checked in (i.e. dropped off luggage, room was not ready yet) very early and then gone down to Hanuuma Bay. Returning that evening, we were tired and sticky icky and needed showers and had very little time before the Mai Tai night started. We wished out loud as we zipped up the coast, how nice it would be if our multitude of heavy bags would miraculously appear in our room. Noting that this was not a full-service resort, we did not expect this, but thought how nice it would be. Upon return, they happily informed us that everything was in our room ready for us. I proclaimed my undying love for the lady at the front desk and we headed down to our fabulous little pad. In short, I would not hesitate in recommending Paradise Bay to someone looking for a relaxing option outside of Waikiki. I may go so far as to suggest this as THE option if you don’t want to pay Turtle Bay prices or deal with a VRBO rental with cleaning fees and the additional concerns that can surround rentals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: Glob R
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place. We stayed only three days so could not enjoy all the possibilities offered. We did enjoy canoeing, and every morning a great breakfast on the terrace. Driving to Honolulu and other sites is easy, it is well worth staying there and enjoy the view and the quietness, Very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise.....for the most part.”
Reviews.Author: Jackorama1
Reviews.Content: This resort is a perfect place for an out-of-the-way, mellow, scenic stay on Oahu. It consists of several separate buildings on a hill next to a lagoon at the entrance to Kane'ohe Bay, with 2 mountain ranges in the distance. Very beautiful. I've read some negative reviews on Paradise Bay and I think they stem from one particular building that is not so nice and is where we were first assigned. It's basically an apartment building on the street overlooking the neighborhood with the ambiant sounds of dogs, roosters, cars, children....not exactly paradise. I asked to upgrade and was accomodated with no trouble and very little extra cost. Then all was wonderful. The resort offers a few free activities which I encourage everyone to take advantage of: Friday night Mojitos, Wednesday night dinner, and especially the Saturday morning boat ride on the bay. It was a highlight of our trip, with snorkling on one of the best coral reefs I've ever been to, and a chance to walk around on the extensive sand bar. It's also a great way to meet the other guests. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are attractive and comfortable with fans and a/c, and the view is spectacular. We tried several of the restaurants the resort recommended and were never disappointed, and returned a few times to a couple of them. The windward side of Oahu gets more clouds and rain but it's very intermitent and actually a nice break from the hot sun after exploring elsewhere. Depending on your needs, I think the prices are reasonable for what you get. Larger, waterfront buildings can be pretty spendy but for a couple or small family, there are less expensive options that are great. Naturally you can get a great package deal staying in Waikiki but you'll get a Las Vegas strip ambiance that is not the real Hawaii. If you're thinking tropical paradise, think Paradise Bay Resort and and least check out their website.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous transition location when moving in or out of Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Etoileski
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 30 days at Paradise Bay Resort (B&B) on Kaneohe Bay on the windward side of Oahu while we waited for our sea freight to arrive from our previous home in Israel. It was a magical month with breathtaking views of the spectacular mountains and the water of peaceful Kaneohe Bay. The resort changed ownership in the past year and the new oweners, Stephanie and David Ryan, are really trying to spruce the place up. One can rent a studio, one-bedroom, two-bedroom, or even larger accomodation, all with either kitchenette or full kitchen. Our one bedroom suite was quaint with simple island decor (comfortable, not luxurious). The king size bed was extremely comfortable. We had a full kitchen. My husband would have preferred a bigger TV with cable, but we managed with the small TV and local channels. We had A/C (not all suites do) which was essential for us during the hot month of September. Our lanai (balcony) afforded us 240 degree views of spectacular scenary. The staff was so friendly and very helpful. Breakfast is simple each morning, but satisfactory and apart from the complementary fun Wednesday night Hawaiian buffet with live music, there is no restaurant for lunch or dinner. This is why the kitchen comes in so handy. There is also a small swimming pool, hot tub/jacuzzi, and a complementary 2 hour boat ride to the reef and the sand bar on Saturday mornings which is loads of fun (rain or shine). It rains more on the windward side resulting in greener scenary! Of enormous importance to us was the fact that this resort is pet friendly. We have a dog who moved to Hawaii with us, and Abby (our Golden Retriever) also loved Paradise Bay. She was provided a luxurious doggie pillow as well as dog dishes for her food and water. Everyone at the place loved her too. I highly recommend this property for anyone transitioning into or out of Hawaii. Families with children can easily be accomodated. Pets are welcome. Keep in mind that the resort is located in a quiet community neighborhood (chickens and dogs plus the mynas in the mangrove make most of the noise) and is not frenetic like Waikiki but slow paced and relaxed. If one is looking for a more traditional and quieter than Honolulu/Waikiki Oahu experience, then this could be a wonderful destination for just a few days as well.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven in kaneohe”
Reviews.Author: Abigail L
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Paradise Bay Resort. Upon mine and my husbands arrival, we were greeted by kind attentive staff and a cool breeze accomonaied by tradiotional island music. Our room was modern yet true to a Hawaiian style. We were lavished in amazing linens, a beautiful view, and fresh air blowing through the room. This resort also accomodated my pets as if they were human guests. We thoroughly enjoyed the pool as well as mojito night and the boat cruise. This resort is centrally located and we found it easy to navigate around the island. Tops staying in noisy, over crowded Waikiki. The owners Stephanie and David Ryan could not have been more accomodating. We will be booking again here soon. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: alexis b
Reviews.Content: This place is so magic. What impressed me most were the hard wood floors, and fine quality linens. Nothing is better than crisp fresh sheets to tuck you in. The location has amazing views. It is a great retreat spot for an artist. I would come back and bring my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Termite and Ant Infested, $200 a Night, Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Martha B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live on island, but wanted a break and decided to go to a resort for the weekend with our 6 month old baby, 6 year old American Bulldog and another couple. We booked a 2 bedroom room. The resort was advertising dogs were free for the month of September, but a dog room cost $175 a night ($209 after taxes) rather than the advertised price at $145. They explained to us, even though pets are free, the pet room itself (same layout and size as a regular room) cost $30 more. We decided to book it anyways. When we arrived the "resort" looked like a motel. It was located in in a residential area wedged between houses. When we checked in and saw our room, we were disappointed to see how small and dusty the room was. The king sized beds were twin size beds pushed together. Our view from the bedroom was a huge heap of trash. We then noticed a few ants in the kitchen. I went down stairs and asked their policy on leaving and they said we have to pay for the first night because it's nonrefundable, but we could cancel the second night, so we did. We all went to the pool to go swimming and were shocked to find the pool was dirty and had a film floating on the top. We swam anyways thinking we would shower when we got back to our room. On the way back to our room, my friends went to the spa to schedule a massage, but they said you had to schedule all spa services 24 hours in advance. We went back to our room, showered and got ready to leave for dinner. Right before we left, my husband grabbed the dog bowl provided to fill it with dog food, but noticed it was filthy and had food crusted on it. He washed the bowl and filled it with dry dog food then left for dinner. When we returned, my husband noticed the dog food and mat underneath it were covered with ants. He threw the dog food away and went downstairs to show management the mat and complain. They told my husband that they would spray tomorrow. I was changing the baby on the bed and saw ants crawling all over the comforter. This was the last straw for me. Fed up, I went downstairs to the front desk asking if we could move rooms. I was told we could only move one room over because it was a dog room. I told him that a wall was not enough to keep the ants away. Plus, the wall had a kitchen on each side, so there were holes for the pipes to run through it and the ants could run back and forth on them. He told me because we had a dog, that was the only room. I went back to the room and asked my husband if I could see how many ants were on the dog food, so he pulled the trash out, and to my horror, it was covered in ants and termites. I freaked out and went back to the front desk and asked if we could leave and get our money back. I had taken pictures of the trash to show him so he would know I was not exaggerating about the termites. He told me he had to call the managers and ask them. An hour had passed and I still hadn't heard from him, so I went back to the front desk and he said the owners said that because they spray once a month, it wasn't their problem. They said I could leave that night, but would have to pay a $50 cleaning fee just for occupying the room. It was late and the new room was bug free, so I decided to stay. Plus there were no outside lights for the walkway and it would be dangerous going up and down the stairs with no lights and arms full of luggage. I used the light from my phone to go up and down the stairs to talk to the front desk. All night a rooster form one of the houses kept crowing and kept waking up the baby all night long. When I woke up in the morning, there were ants and termites all over the kitchen sink, kitchen counter and just ants in the shower. Nobody showered in the new room's bathroom, so I have no idea why they would be in the shower and we didn't eat or cook anything in the kitchen either. We left immediately after we saw the bugs in the new room.

Reviews.Title: “great new place in paradise”
Reviews.Author: scot o
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Paradise Bay this spring, 2011. Spring is a great time to be in Hawaii. If you love Oahu but are tired of Waikiki and prefer a more peaceful environment, then I highly recommend this hotel. Set up in a boutique style, these newly renovated spaces have all unique floor plans to accommodate couples or group parties in some of the multiple bedroom units, overlooking the water.
