Big clean new kitchens if you want to cook in, clean bathrooms, and our unit had an awesome balcony overlooking the mountains and the bay. It was breathtaking. There were free Mai-tai Wed. and a boat that goes out to the see the reef and snorkel on sat. The hotel is close to Kaneohe for groceries and restaurants, etc, and 30 min by car from Waikiki, only 45 min on the bus. There is a pool, jacuzzi, kayaks and kite surfing. The staff was friendly and attentive and the owners David and Stephanie were really cool. Its so peaceful and quiet you'll never want to leave. Perfect for a romantic get-away. but I could see coming with family and friends being great as well. Last but not least, tiki torches! Check out this hidden gem. -s-

Reviews.Title: “Lucky find”
Reviews.Author: Jean B
Reviews.Content: We had three nights to spend in Oahu, September 6th- 8th, to break our journey across the Pacific. We were lucky to find Paradise Bay, away from the high-rise nightmare and shopping malls of Honolulu/Waikiki. It's in a lush, green area, unlike the brown around most of the rest of the coast, with views across the bay to the mountains. Highway 3 gets you to the airport in well under an hour. We were lucky to be there for a complimentary buffet dinner and Hawaiian music on Wednesday. We left before the social drinks on Friday evening and a boat trip to the sand bar on Saturday. I think we took the cheapest room option which was fine for us, as was the complimentary buffet breakfast, which included fresh fruit and yoghurt. The staff were friendly and helpful. In the vicinity, Haliewa Joe's restaurant was a short drive away and a delight, set in a garden and with mountains as a backdrop. We enjoyed walking in the botanical garden at Kaliewa and there were trails at Ka'a'awa reserve a short drive away, one impassable in the forest. Kahama reserve's trails may be better. We'll certainly recommend Paradise Bay to our friends, and return there ourselves if we do another round-the-world trip.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: bettmark
Reviews.Content: We chose this place for its distance from Waikiki, even though it was much more expensive than the nice resort hotels on Waikiki Beach. Not directly on Kaneohe Bay but on a small, muddy waterway that exits into the bay. In a local neighborhood, poorly marked directions into property. No AC, rooms are clean, sparse, with very nice sized lanais but drably painted in army green, black & brown, poor WiFi reception. The property is very small and crowded, only 40 rooms and roads going down the middle of the property. Very noisy, especially if there is any rain, cars spin their wheels trying to get up the steep incline and voices carry a long way. Construction underway and the noise was amazing, compounded by the workers talking loudly. Breakfast was pretty disappointing. Watery juices, bagels, bread for toasting, small yogurts, cottage cheese, coffee & tea. All carbs, no protein at all. The pool is tiny, not very inviting. Great dock w/ocean kayaks available. We paid $165 for a $195 room looking directly at the muddy "creek". The staff was pretty friendly, out of state owners. We moved to the Sheraton Kaiulani with a $12 resort fee that included free WiFi, free parking, free beach towels & beach chairs, an attendant came to the beach and brought us free cold water and cold fruit - all for $25 a night less than what we were paid at Paradise Bay Resort . We liked the Windward side of the island alot, but will try a condo or rental instead next time.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is a best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: Susan N
Reviews.Content: Paradise Bay Resort is delightful for anyone looking for a true Hawaiian experience. The resort has a calm and relaxing feel to it. It's a real value which includes amenities such as complimentary breakfast, snorkeling equipment, kayaks, Saturday morning boat trip, Wednesday night dinner, and drinks on certain days. The owners seem to care about their guests and really make you feel welcome. It's location is an easy drive to local sights and places.

Reviews.Title: “What a great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Xoorosh
Reviews.Content: The further we drove from the airport the more beautiful the scenery got. H1 to 63 then to 83 and finally the hotel. The views are breath taking. Darcy welcomed us and checked us in. Sweet and professional. This place is for those who want a feel of the real Hawaii and not the corporate hotels and the traffic. That night there was complimentary dinner and a band named Kimo. Great food and great entertainment. Doreen was in charge if the buffet and took great care of us. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A complete disappointment”
Reviews.Author: harry c
Reviews.Content: WOW, this was a complete RIP-OFF. First, there was no resort sign from the main street to indicate the turn off from the main road. Second, you have to drive thru the middle of a rundown neighborhood (complete with rusted cars on blocks, and hanging laundry) to get to the place. Third, the appearance is not worthy of the title "resort". We were charged $209 a night, for a one room suite, and we were expecting a real resort, not the shady looking, half star motel with matching accommodations. If the steep stairs leading to the rooms, the squeaky fllors, or the noisy air conditioners were not a problem, then maybe the cockroaches in the kitchen and the baby termites might entice you to a better choice. We were scheduled to stay for seven nights but decided to leave after one night. We wondered why no one in management asked why we left so early and unexpectedly. Oh yeah, the view of the bay is fantastic, that is if you can stand still long enough while your skin is crawling. DO NOT EVER STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hideaway”
Reviews.Author: CheshireSue_W
Reviews.Content: I would describle this as a delightful hideaway rather than a resort. The location of our waterside room was stunning, with a nice back-to-nature feel. Accomodaton was comfortable, spacous & well equiped, the staff friendly & helpful. There was a little noise from the adjoining unit on their party night (yes, the walls are a liittle thin) but not enough to prevent us sleeping -there was more noise from birdlife (dawn & dusk chorus each day). Nice beakfast on balcony with great views overlooking the bay & mountains. Didn't find much locally in the way of dining options in the evening, (but then we didn't really look that hard!). We really enjoyed our stay, (but no, it wasn't cheap)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay and hold events!!!”
Reviews.Author: dfarrister
Reviews.Content: I was looking for somewhere different, unique, tropical and quiet to hold a baby shower and Paradise Bay was the absolute perfect place! The resort has a beautiful dining area that we were able sit, relax and privately share the afternoon while overlooking Kaneohe Bay! There is a wet bar and kitchen, tables and chairs and they played music for us, as well. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful! The event coordinator, Sarah Godden helped me plan, organize and set up a beautiful baby shower day. THANK YOU PARADISE BAY RESORT FOR A BEAUTIFUL DAY AND LIFELONG MEMORIES!! Not only did I enjoy my baby shower day here, I returned for a Mother-to-be massage package! A private relaxing room was set up and Patty, the massage therapist was very professional. The massage was extremely helpful with easing pregnancy pains! I would love to return to the resort for an event, stay and/or massage!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing. We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: loismoe
Reviews.Content: Staff was very accommodating. The papaya and pineapple at the continental breakfast each morning was delicious. Hawaiian entertainment on Wed was well done and the food was excellent and free. Units were clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and we especially loved Darcie who was able to provide at the last minute lovely accommodations. Great cooks, mother and daughter team, Amber and Dorene. Great resort for families as well as couples.

Reviews.Title: “Our new vacation home on Oahu”
Reviews.Author: Fenixfarmer
Reviews.Content: I write this review in the middle of our 12 day stay...We love this place! The mountain views, the free Saturday boat excursion, the tranquility of the bay, the free kayak use, the included breakfast, the very easy parking. We visited Waikiki yesterday for the longboard classic surf competition and wondered why anyone on vacation would want to subject themselves to the stresses of high-rise living, impossible parking, the blare of horns in congested traffic, and a general lack of peace one finds in a concrete jungle. Here we are experiencing a genuine Hawaii experience in an authentic tropical setting. Looking forward to the Wednesday dinner, live music and mai-tais.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon in perfect paradise”
Reviews.Author: jester33
Reviews.Content: this was the most amazing place!! words cannot desribe how great the view, the room, even the hotel staff went out of their way for us- this was beyond my expectations. the price is great, there's free excursions like snorkelling and kayaking, a saturday boat ride to the sand bar, free dinner and mai tai nite, a live hawaiian music and dinner nite , all included in the price of your stay, which was waaaayyy less than the other hotels on the island, and it included so much more. they even have an on-call massage lady! (i even came home at the end of the day to clean laundry for only a few bucks!) your away from the hustle and bustle of the city of waikiki but close enough to go when you want that. we are from Los angeles and were on our honeymoon, so the last thing we wanted was city and noise. this place kept our days full (when we wanted) and peaceful and serene when we didnt want city life! i am so glad we found this hidden gem. certainly affordable enough for us to go back again soon!! oh yah, the showers and beds are amazing. 5 star resort balcony views also. the layout is great where you can join rooms to balconies for larger groups...i could have stayed here forever. loved it!! very kid friendly as well. lots of fun for the honeymoon couple like us, people who want to be alone, or large parties- all spectrums. there were all kinds of people staying here, but it was always peaceful, quiet, and perfect! i dont have one bad thing to say. just that i would have liked to stay longer. AMAZING!!

Reviews.Title: “We will not be back - this is not a "resort" and not a good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: hbclee
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be able to recommend this place to people since it appears the new management is really trying to refurbish the place. However, the cons outweighed the pros and when we finally decided to check out 2 days early, the reaction from mangement was defensive and poor - not what you would expect from a business trying to attract customers. Pro's: Decent size condo unit, good kitchen. Free w-fi (although slow). Free parking. The Saturday boat excursion was the best part of the stay. Breakfast was decent. Con's: Too many bugs! Tiny ants all over the lobby tables. Mosquitoes kept me awake at night. We had several bites from mosquitoes and fleas (there are feral cats all over the neighborhood as well as wild chickens). The resort in in a low-income, run-down area and you definitely do not get a welcoming feel from the locals around there. Poorly lit bathroom, paint peeling from the walls, shower curtains had mildew. TV was an old model and remote didn't work. Our lanai was small and not covered so we couldn't use it much due to all the rain. It was also very noisy when the other units nearby had social gatherings. Main complaint was the price! $275 a night (came out to over $300 w/taxes) for the 2-bedroom premium view unit was not worth it! We spoke to other guests - one couple paid $135/night through a Groupon special for a 2 bedroom unit on the water. Another family paid $179/night for a 3 bedroom non-view unit. Note that housekeeping is only every other day. We did not get good value for the money we paid. I wish them luck in the future but unfortunately we will not be back and cannot recommend Paradise Bay Resort to our friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel with some definite problems and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BlueSuedePumps
Reviews.Content: This hotel has both good points and bad points. This would be fine, but the price--we paid $200 per night to stay a couple--demands a higher level of overall quality. Good points: The staff is incredibly friendly, and you aren't anywhere near the bustle of Waikiki. The free internet and free parking are really nice, although the free internet is a public access point and can't do high-speed streaming (no Netflix instant!). The Wednesday night with music was lovely. Finally, it really is nice to have a fridge and mini-kitchen. Bad points: There is no A/C, and it gets humid. Hopefully, you won't spend tons of time in your room, but I would worry about this if you are used to A/C. The biggest problem, by far, is NOISE LEVELS. These are cheap apartments which have been converted into hotel rooms. While they have obviously renovated the exterior, the facility wasn't originally intended as a hotel, and therefore the walls are incredibly thin. Unlike a normal hotel, even when people are talking in the next room at a reasonable level, you still hear them. (It wasn't just our room; at check-out, one of the other guests mentioned the ame thing.) It's even worse on the lanai. I had a vision of sitting quietly together a couple and looking out at a beautiful bay. Unfortunately, the family next door was playing cards on their lanai. They were at a very reasonable noise level, but the walls were so thin, it was just weird to be out on ours. What's the point of staying at a quiet resort away from the bustle of Waikiki if you just end up hearing the conversations of the guests in the next room? I know a number of other posts have mentioned parties. One our second and third nights, we had issues with parties as well. They weren't wild parties, but the walls are way too thin to accommodate even a small crowd. I don't know if this was just bad luck, or if this resort seems to attract large groups. Other quick notes: be warned that this part of the island seems more foggy than the beachside locations, so the views aren't sky blue. There are small issues with the operation of the hotel, e.g. the maid forgot to clean our room one day, the radio appeared to be broken, and they manager did not reply quickly when the toilet broke. Overall, it's a decent hotel, which has a few problems. I think this hotel would be very reasonable at $140/night, but I expected more for $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: LKR1982
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, family feel to the resort, quiet (except for the restoration work taking place) and absolutely stunning views. Nice breakfast, great views again, beautiful environment. Just bliss. Well equipped room (pleased to find a good fridge, freezer and corkscrew for wine!!) Great shower (pressure was perfect). Liked the feel of the place. Good value for money. Room was clean, good size, loads of storage and felt safe and private. Free wifi-always a bonus, easy parking. Quite a unique place. Would defininately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Tranquility overlooking the beautiful Koolau Mountains”
Reviews.Author: charlotte04050
Reviews.Content: We are fortunate to have our son and daughterinlaw living on Oahu and wanted to be as near to them in Kaneohe as we could. They knew Paradise Bay previous to the new owners and thought that it would be comfortable but that it was a bit run down. We arrived in the evening and didn't realize until we woke the next morning how beautiful the views from our bayfront cottage was. And yes, there is ongoing work, but the workers were patient enough to begin their day when most of the guests at Paradise Bay were on their way to sightsee. We were only going to stay 5 nights and then move on to another resort, but we loved being here so much, that we stayed another 3 days. The staff was very attentive, courteous, and had the aloha spirit we came to enjoy. The fresh breakfasts were delicious and the Wednesday evening dinner and entertainment were a real treat...the management even allowed our son and daughterinlaw to join us. We have traveled all over the world and truly enjoyed this piece of paradise...we definitely will return and look forward to seeing the new Paradise Bay! Mahalo, Tom and Charlotte Hedge, Sarasota, FL

Reviews.Title: “I love this place, wish I could live here!”
Reviews.Author: Jennftb
Reviews.Content: If you like a laid back, mom and pop style, pristine outdoor environment resort, stay here! I love the helpful service, outdoor spaces, views, and kayaks! Plus the sandbar tour and the Wed dinner are highlights! I even love the chickens and roosters, because they highlight the rural feel of this place. It's far enough from Waikiki and close to the North shore, great base for exploring the island.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bonnieyagiela
Reviews.Content: We were there before it was sold. I am so happy there was a buyer! It would be such a shame if it had to close. Yes, the neighborhood was low-middle class but the people were friendly and the Peacock that wandered around was cool! I loved the staff and had fun talking to them. I hope they were kept on. You had the feeling that his was a small family business. It was very relaxing. We appreciated that we didn't have to pay to go out to breakfast! The breakfast was simple but good. I got some awesome pictures of a lovely rainbow from my balcony! We had fun using the canoes. It was clean, unpretentious, and very reasonable to afford. So glad the place will remain open!

Reviews.Title: “just like home”
Reviews.Author: trippy055
Reviews.Content: Everyting thing there was perfect. the workers were very friendly espically doreen. the dinner was nice with the live music in the back ground wow they played all sorts of music was great. beds very comfortable lanai was hugh and awesome. and our young children loved being by the pool. and the bbq was a big plus cant wait to come back and visit my new family a huy hoe think thats c u later

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: rory808
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay near the Kaawa area as our visit to Hawaii was to attend a wedding in that area. As I used to live in the Kaneohe I am familiar with this residential area. We were quite surprised at the charm this place had and it was very nice to be away from the Waikiki hustle and bustle. This is a quick drive to Kailua beach where we love to close to and the drive out to the north shore from here is always beautiful. Our view of the Koolau's were stunning and the full moon at night wasn't to shabby either...in fact I have that as my new screen saver now. There was construction on-going, but for the most part did not bother us, we didn't have any problems with the noise. One night there was someone that worked there parked in our assigned stall. My only disappointment was not being able to go on the boat ride out to the sand bar and not having an elevator could be a disadvantage to some people. We would definately stay there again as I have family and friends in the area, and like I said Kailua beach is such an easy access. Kailua town seems alot busier with tourist activity than when I live on the Windward side so this is alot quieter. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. Nice to have free WiFi and kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, with a beautiful view and warm, friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: chajushu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in a very decent, renovated studio. It had two queen beds, kitchenette, AC and tropical ceiling fan, a small but nice bathroom, and a lanai overlooking the pool and the mangroves of Kaneohe Bay. In the background was a beautiful view of the Koolau Mountains. You could hear the birds singing morning and evening in this lush, green tropical setting. Breakfast every morning with fresh papaya, pineapple, and yogurt. Wednesday evenings offers a great buffet dinner and great Hawaiian entertainment. The staff is warm and friendly expressing much Aloha. The facilities are old and construction crews are working six days a week to renovate the buildings and rooms which do need repair work. The resort is built on a hillside and you have to go up and down stairs. This is an excellent getaway for an independent traveler like me, and I saw families with children here too. I will definately stay here again on my next regular trip to Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: JenelleVO
Reviews.Content: This place was so awesome I don't know where to begin! Just recently, the Paradise Bay Resort was newly acquired by a wonderful couple who are so personable and friendly. All the bad reviews must have come from travelers who visited before the new owners took over. The gal is an architect and she said she plans on revamping the whole site, which is essentially a block of independent condos, houses, the works. It is a little sketchy from the outside, but fabulous on the inside! Our room was massive, and this is compared to the 2 other places in Oahu we stayed at a comparable price. It had everything we needed, including a spacious refridgerator and microwave. Beautiful bedding, tons of storage, laminate wood flooring, and a lanai that was the size of another room! Everything was really modern, which isn't common on the island (at least not at this price). The best part about the room was the breath-taking view, which overlooked Kaneohe Bay and mountains in the distance. Extremely private, romantic, and clean! Oh and if you're a bug-a-phobe, like I am, rest assured they take care of the pest so you won't run into the common roaches of Hawaii :) The staff--blew me away! They are one big, smiling family who welcomed us in as their own! My son is a handful, and they all made him feel so special, they were so friendly with him! They also serve breakfast every morning, and if you were to go to say, IHOP, you'd drop a good 40 dollars on comparable food! On Wednesday nights, they have a live band come in and perform while you get FREE dinner. And it's not slop! The cook, who is also the manager, can throw down in the kitchen! It's so awesome to get a home cooked meal when you're on vacation. They also served yummy Mai Tais! I wish I was back, this was the best experience I've had on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: relaxinglady
Reviews.Content: Stay from Wednesday to Saturday, Buffet dinner and Hawaiian Music on Wednesdays, Mojitos and local style appetizer on Friday nights, free kayaking. They are renovating but it was still peaceful, my room was on the canal, nothing to do but chill on my deck and read my book, that what I came for, papaya's for breakfast this was right out of a book, I'm going back!

Reviews.Title: “Real Hawaiian”
Reviews.Author: DCody
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the beaten path in a real Hawaiian neighborhood. From some of the reviews, some people should never leave the resort area of Waikiki. We only stayed here one night. Because of airline schedules we had to spend a night on Oahu (which we usually try to avoid) en-route to Kaua'i and Lana'i. This hotel seemed to be the ticket. We were going to the Polynesian Cultural Center the next day and then flying out. We just needed a place to sleep. Well as it turns out I would have been comfortable staying here several days. It needs to be mentioned that this hotel is under new management and it appears that it has needed some tender loving care for some years. It is now getting it. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms and it was very nice. The setting is beautiful. The Continental Breakfast was more than adequate. If I am ever stuck on Oahu again, I will surely stay here.
